notes: Targeting a unit causes the breaths to be released towards the unit's position
Both the icy and fiery wave travel at a speed of 1050, taking 0.71 ( 1.43) seconds to travel the full distance

The icy breath deals 0 damage to affected units and fully procs on-damage effects (e.g
  Corrosive Skin), and then applies its movement speed and attack speed slow
 The icy breath first applies its damage, then the debuff
 Successive casts reapplies the icy breath and update the slow values based on its current values

The fiery breath is released 0.2 seconds after the icy breath is released
 This means it is possible for enemies to be hit by only one of the breaths, by getting in or out of range of the second breath
 Jakiro cannot move until both waves are released, but can use items and abilities, and turn a little bit between the first and the second breath

With the travel distance and end radius, Dual Breath can hit units up to 1025 ( 1775) range away
 The complete area of both breaths is shaped like a cone

Deals 10/20/30/40 ( 20/40/60/80) damage in 0.5-second intervals, starting immediately after the fire debuff is placed, the second interval is 0.1 seconds, the rest are 0.5 seconds, resulting in 11 instances
 The first damage instance deals 0 damage and fully procs on-damage effects
 Can deal up to 100/200/300/400 ( 200/400/600/800) damage (before reductions) to a single unit
 Successive casts neither stack nor update the damage values of the current instance but refreshes its duration
 It also continues ticking with the same intervals as the first cast
abilities.description: An icy blast followed by a wave of fire launches out in a path in front of Jakiro. The ice slows enemies, while the fire delivers damage over time.
abilities.name: Dual Breath
abilities.story: Pyrexae dragons have tremendously dangerous breath for each branch of the species; combining them is unimaginable.

notes: Despite the visual effects, Ice Path's effects do not have to travel, and are instantly applied after the 0.5-second delay

The Ice Path starts 12 range in front of Jakiro and has a length of 1200
 With the starting distance, path length and path radius, Ice Patch can hit units up to 1362 range away
 It can also hit units 138 range behind Jakiro, due to its radius and starting position

Enemy units that come within 150 radius of the path while it is up get stunned and damaged by it
 The stun duration is independent of the path duration
 However, the stun duration expires as soon as the path disappears
 The path grants 150 range flying vision along the path based on the path duration
 Enemies may only be stunned once per cast, so if dispeled, they cannot get stunned by it again
 Ice Path first applies the debuff, then the damage
abilities.description: Creates a path of ice that stuns and damages enemies that touch it.
abilities.name: Ice Path
abilities.story: Jakiro's cunning right head calls upon its frozen heritage, glazing the earth with blistering cold.

notes:
Liquid Fire's cast range can only be further increased by attack range bonuses of the same range as the caster
 However, it is not affected by cast range bonus
 Uses Jakiro's 400 ( 675) attack range when Autocast is active
 Manually casting it uses the 600 ( 875) cast range

Applies Liquid Fire around and on the target regardless of whether the attack missed or is disjointed
 However, when the target turns invisible, invulnerable or hidden before impact, Liquid Fire is not applied at all

Successive casts do not stack but refreshes its debuff duration
 It also continues ticking with the same intervals as the first cast
 However, the attack speed slow values are updated upon successive casts, but not the damage values
The attack first applies the debuff, then its own attack damage

Fully affects buildings
 Does not affect allied units or wards

Deals 7.5/10/12.5/15 damage in 0.5-second intervals, starting 0.5 seconds after the debuff is applied, resulting in 10 damage instances
 Can deal up to 75/100/125/150 damage (before reductions) to a single target
When off cooldown, the fire head's mouth drools fire, visible to everyone

SHARD NOTES Liquid Frost has a higher priority than Liquid Fire in the group of active attack modifiers In most situations, Liquid Frost will be cast instead while having either abilities with Autocast on The only way to launch both Liquid Fire and Liquid Frost is by manual casting Liquid Frost with Liquid Fire Autocast on However, if Jakiro has more than 5 items equipped, including neutral items, [Town Portal Scroll] Town Portal Scroll and the consumed [Aghanim's Shard] Aghanim's Shard, he will only apply Liquid Frost on to the target
abilities.description: Jakiro burns his enemies in an area of effect with fire added to his attack, while slowing their attacks.
abilities.name: Liquid Fire
abilities.story: The left maw of Jakiro opens, laying waste to any in its path.

notes: Requires [Aghanim's Shard] Aghanim's Shard to be unlocked

Liquid Frost's cast range can only be further increased by attack range bonuses of the same range as the caster
 However, it is not affected by cast range bonus
 Uses Jakiro's 400 ( 675) attack range when Autocast is active
 Manually casting it uses the 600 ( 875) cast range

Applies Liquid Frost around and on the target regardless of whether the attack misses or is disjointed or not
 However, when the target turns spell immune or invulnerable before impact, Liquid Frost is not applied at all
Successive casts do not stack but refresh the debuff
The attack first applies the debuff, then the stun, then its own attack damage

Fully affects buildings
 Does not affect allied units or wards
Deals damage in 1-second intervals, starting 1 second after the debuff is applied, resulting in 4 damage instances
Can deal up to 80 + 8% of max health as damage to a single target (before reductions)
When off cooldown, the ice head's mouth glows and releases light blue smoke, visible to everyone
SHARD NOTES  Liquid Fire's Autocast notes fully apply
abilities.description: Jakiro adds a frost effect to his attack, stunning enemies. Enemies hit are slowed and receive a percent their max health per second plus a base amount as damage every 1 second for 4 seconds.
params: Max Health as Damage per Second: 2%
abilities.name: Liquid Frost

notes: Macropyre instantly applies its effects over the whole distance, it does not have any travel time

Macropyre starts 234 range in front of Jakiro and has a length of 1166 ( 1566)
 With the starting distance, path length and path radius, Macropyre can hit units up to 1660 ( 2060) range away
 It can also hit units 26 range behind Jakiro, due to its radius and starting position
Places a debuff on enemies within the area in 0.5-second intervals, starting 0.5 seconds after cast

The debuff does not stack
 When standing inside the fire, its duration gets refreshed
 The debuff deals 55/77.5/100 ( 70/92.5/115) damage in 0.5-second intervals, starting 0.5 seconds after being placed, resulting in 4 damage instances
 This results in a maximum of 23 ( 53) damage instances when standing within the area the full duration
 One instance of the debuff can deal up to 220/310/400 ( 280/370/460) damage (before reductions)

Successive casts do not stack but refreshes its debuff duration
 It also continues ticking with the same intervals and damage values as the first cast
Can deal up to 1265/1782.5/2300 ( 1610/2127.5/2645) damage to a single unit (before reductions)

SCEPTER NOTES The piercing spell immunity upgrade is determined if Jakiro has [Aghanim's Scepter] Aghanim's Scepter equipped, and not upon cast Therefore, it instantly updates the current damage instances It also changes Macropyre's sound effect and it is now audible through the Fog of War It can now deal up to 2915/4107.5/5300 ( 3710/4902.5/6095) damage to a single unit
abilities.description: Jakiro exhales a wide line of lasting flames, which deals damage per second to any enemy units caught in the fire.
abilities.name: Macropyre
abilities.story: Ice and fire combine to rip the battlefield to shreds with extreme temperatures.

description: Freezes and burns enemies with magic. Most Pyrexae Dragons are hatched with one head, attuned to either ice or fire. Then there was Jakiro, an accident of nature. Possessing the might of both elements, the twin-headed dragon's Dual Breath freezes and burns simultaneously. Gobs of Liquid Frost or Liquid Fire adhere to armor and walls, melting down steel and stone alike. Retreating foes are blocked off with Ice Path, giving Jakiro ample time to roast them on his Macropyre.  Support Nuker Pusher Disabler ★☆☆
trivia: Jakiro's fun/alternate name was Double Dragon, referring to the video game franchise developed by Technos Japan.
This line Link▶️ "Burninated." is a reference to Trogdor the Burninator, a character that first appeared in episode 58 of the "Strong Bad e-mail" show on the website HomestarRunner.com.
The line "With fire and ice" is possibly a reference to a famous poem by Robert Frost, titled "Fire and Ice".
history: Even among magical beasts, a twin-headed dragon is a freak. Equal parts ice and fire, cunning and rage, the creature known as Jakiro glides over charred and ice-bound battlefields, laying waste to any who would bear arms against it. Pyrexae dragon clutches always contain two fledglings. Famous for their viciousness even from the first moments of life, newly hatched dragons of this species will try to kill their sibling while still in the nest. Only the strongest survive. In this way is the strength of the Pyrexae line ensured. By some accident of nature, the freak Jakiro hatches from a single egg, combining in a single individual the full range of abilities found within the diverse Pyrexae species. Trapped within the armature of its monstrous body, the powers of ice and fire combine, and now no enemy is safe.

notes: The attack range talent also affects the cast range of Liquid Fire and Liquid Frost.
The health talent increases maximum health capacity, and keeps the current health percentage.
